about_the_game:
Super Words is a puzzle crossword game with innovative new mechanics. Place the given words on the board and connect them according to the provided clues. It's a fantastic game for refreshing your mind and relaxing. You'll find yourself immersed in solving puzzles, connecting letters and words.

You can find 25,000 different puzzles in each of the 8 supported languages, totaling 200,000 puzzles.

The game features 10 different board sizes, ranging from 7x7 to 16x16, catering to players with various preferences. Whether you're seeking relaxation or a challenge, there's something for everyone.

In the game, there are two main types of clues to assist you:

🔹 Corner Clues: Displayed as squares, indicating the first or last letter of a word.

➕ Crossing Clues: Displayed as plus shapes, indicating that two words intersect at that letter, placed horizontally and vertically. This letter could be the first, last, or middle letter of those words.

A level is completed when you connect all the words to the starting golden word on the board, turning them all golden.

Embark on this relaxing journey, a nearly endless adventure in word puzzle-solving.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04, Ubuntu 18.04, and CentOS 7
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.2+ or Vulkan-capable, Nvidia and AMD GPUs.
  • Additional Notes: Gnome desktop environment running on top of X11 windowing system, Nvidia official proprietary graphics driver or AMD Mesa graphics driver. Other configuration and user environment as provided stock with the supported distribution (Kernel, Compositor, etc.)

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: High Sierra 10.13+ (Intel editor) Big Sur 11.0 (Apple silicon Editor)
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel processors) Apple M1 or above (Apple silicon-based processors)
  • Graphics: Metal-capable Intel and AMD GPUs
  • Additional Notes: Apple officially supported drivers (Intel processor) Rosetta 2 is required for Apple silicon devices running on either Apple silicon or Intel versions of the Unity Editor.
